q: Imagination is everything. It is the preview of life's coming attractions.
h:
“Imagination is everything. It is the preview of life's coming attractions.” —
Albert Einstein

q: No matter what happens, always be yourself.
h:
“No matter what happens, always be yourself.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work at hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to focus.
h:
“Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work at hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to focus.” —
Alexander Graham Bell

q: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
h:
“There are no shortcuts to any place worth going. ” —
Beverly Sills

q: Don't let your learning lead to knowledge. Let your learning lead to action.
h:
“Don't let your learning lead to knowledge. Let your learning lead to action.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Everybody needs a passion. That's what keeps life interesting.
h:
“Everybody needs a passion. That's what keeps life interesting.” —
Betty White

q: Don?t hesitate or allow yourself to make excuses. Just get out and do it.
h:
“Don?t hesitate or allow yourself to make excuses. Just get out and do it.” —
Christopher McCandless

q: The attempt to escape from pain, is what creates more pain.
h:
“The attempt to escape from pain, is what creates more pain.” —
Gabor Mate

q: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them.
h:
“Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: One always begins to forgive a place as soon as it's left behind.
h:
“One always begins to forgive a place as soon as it's left behind.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Hope means hoping when everything seems hopeless.
h:
“Hope means hoping when everything seems hopeless.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: The opposite of courage in our society is not cowardice... it is conformity.
h:
“The opposite of courage in our society is not cowardice... it is conformity.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Concentrated power has always been the enemy of liberty.
h:
“Concentrated power has always been the enemy of liberty.” —
Ronald Reagan

q: Don't let the past steal your present.
h:
“Don't let the past steal your present.” —
Cherralea Morgen

q: It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped.
h:
“It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped.” —
Tony Robbins

q: A Rolling Stone Gathers No Moss.
h:
“A Rolling Stone Gathers No Moss.” —
Publilius Syrus

q: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
h:
“Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.” —
Mahatma Gandhi

q: Real loss is only possible when you love something more than you love yourself.
h:
“Real loss is only possible when you love something more than you love yourself.” —
Robin Williams

q: Keep your friends close, and your enemies closer.
h:
“Keep your friends close, and your enemies closer.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Confuse them with your silence and amaze them with your actions.
h:
“Confuse them with your silence and amaze them with your actions.” —
Unknown

q: The friendship that can cease has never been real.
h:
“The friendship that can cease has never been real. ” —
St. Jerome

q: Take responsibility of your own happiness, never put it in other people's hands.
h:
“Take responsibility of your own happiness, never put it in other people's hands.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Giving back involves a certain amount of giving up.
h:
“Giving back involves a certain amount of giving up.” —
Colin Powell

q: Remain calm, serene, always in command of yourself. You will then find out how easy it is to get along.
h:
“Remain calm, serene, always in command of yourself. You will then find out how easy it is to get along. ” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: To seek greatness is the only righteous vengeance.
h:
“To seek greatness is the only righteous vengeance.” —
Criss Jami

q: Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.
h:
“Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Winners never quit and quitters never win.
h:
“Winners never quit and quitters never win.” —
Vince Lombardi

q: Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.
h:
“Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.” —
Helen Keller

q: They say love is the best investment; the more you give, the more you get in return.
h:
“They say love is the best investment; the more you give, the more you get in return.” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.
h:
“Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.” —
Colin Powell

q: Be royal in your own fashion: act like a king to be treated like one.
h:
“Be royal in your own fashion: act like a king to be treated like one.” —
Robert Greene

q: The harder the conflict, the greater the triumph.
h:
“The harder the conflict, the greater the triumph. ” —
George Washington

q: Always try to be a little kinder than necessary.
h:
“Always try to be a little kinder than necessary.” —
James Matthew Barrie

q: One day, in retrospect, the years of struggle will strike you as the most beautiful.
h:
“One day, in retrospect, the years of struggle will strike you as the most beautiful.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: We run to win, not just to be in the race.
h:
“We run to win, not just to be in the race. ” —
Vince Lombardi

q: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
h:
“By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: No snowflake ever falls in the wrong place.
h:
“No snowflake ever falls in the wrong place.” —
Zen Proverb

q: All our knowledge has its origins in our perceptions.
h:
“All our knowledge has its origins in our perceptions.” —
Leonardo da Vinci

q: Be Brave and Take Risks: You need to have faith in yourself. Be brave and take risks. You don't have to have it all figured out to move forward.
h:
“Be Brave and Take Risks: You need to have faith in yourself. Be brave and take risks. You don't have to have it all figured out to move forward.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Throw your heart over the bar and your body will follow.
h:
“Throw your heart over the bar and your body will follow.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go.
h:
“When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go.” —
Carol Burnett

q: Our greatest fears lie in anticipation.
h:
“Our greatest fears lie in anticipation.” —
Honore de Balzac

q: A thing constructed can only be loved after it is constructed; but a thing created is loved before it exists.
h:
“A thing constructed can only be loved after it is constructed; but a thing created is loved before it exists.” —
Charles Dickens

q: We will outstretch the hand if you unclench your fist.
h:
“We will outstretch the hand if you unclench your fist.” —
Barack Obama

q: Leaders think and talk about solutions. Followers think and talk about the problems.
h:
“Leaders think and talk about solutions. Followers think and talk about the problems.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Meanings are not determined by situations, but we determine ourselves by the meanings we give to situations.
h:
“Meanings are not determined by situations, but we determine ourselves by the meanings we give to situations.” —
Alfred Adler

q: Every drop in the ocean counts.
h:
“Every drop in the ocean counts. ” —
Yoko Ono

q: Never put off to tomorrow what you can do to-day.
h:
“Never put off to tomorrow what you can do to-day.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Everyone you meet is fighting a battle you know nothing about. Be kind. Always.
h:
“Everyone you meet is fighting a battle you know nothing about. Be kind. Always.” —
Robin Williams

q: Whoever is happy will make others happy too.
h:
“Whoever is happy will make others happy too.” —
Anne Frank
